com.cloudera.oryx.common.stats

Class RunningStatisticsPerTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cloudera.oryx.common.stats.RunningStatisticsPerTime
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public final class RunningStatisticsPerTime
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Encapsulates a set of statistics, like those in RunningStatistics, but buckets the values by time. For example, this can record mean/max/min values of a process per minute (TimeUnit.MINUTES. Over time, old values will be 'removed' from the statistics. Updates happen passively, in response to calls to refresh() or increment(double).
    Author:
    Sean Owen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      void increment(double value) 
      void refresh()
      Manually refreshes internally computed values that are returned from getCount() and similar methods to reflect what the values should be "now".

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • RunningStatisticsPerTime

        public RunningStatisticsPerTime(TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Parameters:
        timeUnit - size of buckets, in time units, to use. Must be at least TimeUnit.MINUTES.

    • Method Detail

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        Manually refreshes internally computed values that are returned from getCount() and similar methods to reflect what the values should be "now".

      • increment

        public void increment(double value)
        Parameters:
        value - new data point to add, "now" into the current time bucket. Results returned from values like getCount() will be updated in the process.

      • getCount

        public long getCount()
        Returns:
        number of data points in the time window. Note that this value will only be updated to reflect the current time on a call to increment(double) or refresh()

      • getMean

        public double getMean()
        Returns:
        mean of data points the time window. Note that this value will only be updated to reflect the current time on a call to increment(double) or refresh()

      • getMin

        public double getMin()
        Returns:
        minimum data point in the time window. Note that this value will only be updated to reflect the current time on a call to increment(double) or refresh()

      • getMax

        public double getMax()
        Returns:
        maximum data point in the time window. Note that this value will only be updated to reflect the current time on a call to increment(double) or refresh()
